metadata.Title: CVE-2017-6363 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - low.
metadata.Description:
** DISPUTED ** In the GD Graphics Library (aka LibGD) through 2.2.5, there is a heap-based buffer over-read in tiffWriter in gd_tiff.c. NOTE: the vendor says "In my opinion this issue should not have a CVE, since the GD and GD2 formats are documented to be 'obsolete, and should only be used for development and testing purposes.'"

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-6363` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libgd-tools - 2.2.5-5.2ubuntu2.1
libgd3 - 2.2.5-5.2ubuntu2.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> php uses the system libgd2

criterions.comment: libgd2 package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.2.5-5.2ubuntu2.1').
libwmf package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
